summary: The 'Beneficiary Enrollment Notification and Eligibility Simplification 2.0 Act' (BENES 2.0) amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to improve Medicare enrollment information. It mandates the inclusion of clear, concise notices with Social Security account statements for individuals aged 60-65, detailing Medicare eligibility, late enrollment penalties, relief options, benefit coordination, and resources. The bill also requires notices for Social Security beneficiaries prior to Medicare eligibility. Stakeholders will be consulted in the notice's development, which will be periodically reviewed and updated.
